metadata.media: One of 75 drawings contained within a bound book; graphite and colored pencil on paper
metadata.provenance: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Dudley C. Brown

image.caption: White Horse, Kiowa Killing Pawnee, as captioned by D. P. Brown, 1883
Ka-nati, Kiowa Killing Pawnee, as captioned by D. P. Brown, 1883
Clandestine Meeting Betwwen Ke-ah-bone (Kiowa) and the Wife of Pan quodle (Kiowa) at Pan quodle's Tent who he Drug Inside Unconscious, as captioned by D. P. Brown, 1883
Mau-hin (Kiowa) Killing Pawnee, as captioned by D. P. Brown, 1883
Broken Wrist (Kiowa) and Cheyenne Fighting: Broken Wrist on Right, as captioned by D. P. Brown, 1883
Taw-ate, as captioned by D. P. Brown, 1883
Big Brown (Kiowa) and Five of His Braves Dancing - Making Medicine Preparatory to a Buffalo Hunt, as captioned by D. P. Brown, 1883
As-on-daugh (Kiowa) Stealing Quodle-qeah mah (Kiowa Maiden), as captioned by D. P. Brown, 1883
Big Bow Killing Calvary Officer and Private, as captioned by D. P. Brown, 1883
Big Bow Killing Calvary Officer and Private, as captioned by D. P. Brown, 1883
Medicine Lodge, Kiowa, as captioned by D. P. Brown, 1883
Cauder-daugh (Kiowa) Stealing Kiowa Woman, Cauder-zone, as captioned by D. P. Brown, 1883
Making Foundation for Kiowa Medicine Woman, Cauder-zone, as captioned by D. P. Brown, 1883
To-hane-daugh and Party Carrying "Medicine" to Medicine Lodge, as captioned by D. P. Brown, 1883
I-yant and Young Men Dancing, as captioned by D. P. Brown, 1883
Kiowa Lodges--Encampment, as captioned by D. P. Brown, 1883
Tine-tah and Young Man Dressed to Represent Buffaloes, as captioned by D. P. Brown, 1883
While Hunting Them to Procure a Buffalo Bull's Head for a Medicine Dance, as captioned by D. P. Brown, 1883

Haun-geah-ah Ka (Kiowa) is Surprised by Navajo while Upia Tru (sic?) Trying to to Rob a Buzzard's Nest. Navajo upon Seeing Haun-geah-ah Ka Attempts to Kill him but is Killed Himself by Huan-geah-ah Kah's Friend Dane-Cah (Kiowa) who upon seeing the NavajoÂ , 1883
To-yape (Kiowa) Killing Ute with Gun, as captioned by D. P. Brown, 1883
Wo-e-boy (Kiowa) Stealing Mo-quo Kiowa Girl, as captioned by D. P. Brown, 1883
Hoaf-to-ti (Kiowa) and Two Braves Dancing War Dance, as captioned by D. P. Brown, 1883
Koy-mau Making Medicine for Devine Blessing, as captioned by D. P. Brown, 1883
Audle-ta Returning with His Wife after Capturing Her from Tane-die with whom She Eloped, as captioned by D. P. Brown, 1883
On-ta-zoodli (Kiowa) Stealing Choue-geat (Kiowa), as captioned by D. P. Brown, 1883
Chanate (Kiowa) Stealing Two Maidens (Kiowa), as captioned by D. P. Brown, 1883
White Horse (Kiowa) and Two of His Braves Dancing, as captioned by D. P. Brown, 1883
Pau-geat and To-ya (Kiowas) Making Love to Two Kiowa Maidens, as captioned by D. P. Brown, 1883
Chane-doodle (Kiowa) Overtaken After Eloping with the Wife of Tau-dome, Tau-dome Killed His Wife and Takes All of Chane-doodle's Clothing and Ponies, as captioned by D. P. Brown, 1883
Ko-mo-beadle Stealing Cheyenne Woman, as captioned by D. P. Brown, 1883
Au-yea and Wife out Hunting, as captioned by D. P. Brown, 1883
Cheyenne Killing To-ya-so (Kiowa), as captioned by D. P. Brown, 1883
Tong-ke-i-he (Kiowa) Killing Pawnee, as captioned by D. P. Brown, 1883
Pau-ah (Kiowa) Killing Two Pawnees, as captioned by D. P. Brown, 1883
Kiowa Woman Dancing, as captioned by D. P. Brown, 1883
Bau-ah (Kiowa) Killing Pawnee, as captioned by D. P. Brown, 1883
Pawnees Returning to Their Homes After Losing Their Ponies in Engagements with Kiowas, as captioned by D. P. Brown, 1883
An-one (Kiowa) Being Killed by Cheyenne, as captioned by D. P. Brown, 1883
Kiowa Lodges, as captioned by D. P. Brown, 1883
Pe-ah (Kiowa) Stealing Da-him's Wife from His Lodge, as captioned by D. P. Brown, 1883
Do-yant Eloping with Kiowa Maiden, as captioned by D. P. Brown, 1883
Pawnees and Kiowas Fight in Circle made of Brush after Repulsing U.S. Calvary, as captioned by D. P. Brown, 1883
Mo-chi (Kiowa) Stealing Kan-quodle quodle (Kiowa) Maiden, as captioned by D. P. Brown, 1883
White Horse Killing Ute, as captioned by D. P. Brown, 1883
Cheyenne Women Dancing, as captioned by D. P. Brown, 1883
Cheyenne Braves Dancing, as captioned by D. P. Brown, 1883
Bau-daugh Killing Infantry Officer, as captioned by D. P. Brown, 1883

Navajo Returning to His Tepee and Finds Tracks of His Horses that have been Stolen by Kiowas - Pursues Kiowas who are just over the Hill from His Camp and is Killed by Them, as captioned by D. P. Brown, 1883
Tah-bah (Kiowa) Kills Eagle Perched on Tree Top but Fails to See Three Deer Grazing Near Trunk of Tree until after He Shoots When the Deer Escape, as captioned by D. P. Brown, 1883
Kaw-him (Kiowa) Wounds Deer and Pursues Until He Overtakes it when He Kills It, as captioned by D. P. Brown, 1883
Paudlety (Kiowa) Steals Kiowa Maiden, as captioned by D. P. Brown, 1883
Tso-tigh and Two Braves Dancing War Dance, as captioned by D. P. Brown, 1883
Go-ye tahbo (Kiowa) Fails in His Attempt to Persuade Kiowa Married Woman to Elope with Him, as captioned by D. P. Brown, 1883
Cheyenne Killing Ah-go (Kiowa), as captioned by D. P. Brown, 1883
Cheyenne Killing Ute, as captioned by D. P. Brown, 1883
Cheyenne Killing Quodle pah (Kiowa), as captioned by D. P. Brown, 1883
Ah-tah-lah (Kiowa) Journeying to His Sweetheart's Lodge, as captioned by D. P. Brown, 1883
Tau-ta-Kah (Kiowa) Making Medicine in Accordance with Old Custom, as captioned by D. P. Brown, 1883
Lu-hah (Kiowa) Going into Medicine Lodge to Make "Medicine" for Departing Officers Just Preparing to Leave, as captioned by D. P. Brown, 1883
Tone-go (Kiowa) Meeting His Sweetheart, as captioned by D. P. Brown, 1883
Kiowa Woke-on-Lodge. Ah-done-da-ga at Entrance Receiving Food from Taw mah (Kiowa) Woman After Night's Debautch, as captioned by D. P. Brown, 1883
Mauu-geah (Kiowa) Killing Sioux, as captioned by D. P. Brown, 1883
Zabile (Kiowa) Steals Kiowa Maiden who afterwards becomes his wife, as captioned by D. P. Brown, 1883
Pautigh and Braves Performing Tribal Dance, as captioned by D. P. Brown, 1883
Braves Dancing around White Captive Who is being Burnt to the Stake (After being Scalped), as captioned by D. P. Brown, 1883
I-Yau (Kiowa) Kills one of the Sioux Attacking Him and then Escapes, as captioned by D. P. Brown, 1883
Haun-pa (Kiowa) Making Love to Bo-in- cha's Wife at the Utes' Camp at Night, as captioned by D. P. Brown, 1883
Cheyenne Kills Chane-tone (Kiowa), as captioned by D. P. Brown, 1883
Peadle-Kah and Mau-Saw (Kiowas) Rivals for the Affections of Kiowa Maiden - Peadle-Kah Successful, as captioned by D. P. Brown, 1883
Zabile (Kiowa) Steals Kiowa Maiden who Afterwards becomes His Wife, as captioned by D. P. Brown, 1883
Quauah, Head Commanche Chief Making Medicine Before Engaging in Wo-gau Debautch, as captioned by D. P. Brown, 1883
Sau-taugh-Koy Steals Guo-geiu-ha's Wife at the Ute's Camp at Night, as captioned by D. P. Brown, 1883
Guo-chaudle (Kiowa) behind Medicine Shield Beckoning for His Sweetheart to Come to Him, as captioned by D. P. Brown, 1883
Mine-yock (Kiowa) Kills Pawnee, as captioned by D. P. Brown, 1883
Kiowa Performing a Messiah Dance, as captioned by D. P. Brown, 1883
